title: eGovernment - Social Enterprises and Socio-Technical Perspectives
abstractText:
The research explores in depth the role of social enterprises in the design and delivery of eGovernment services. Whilst also developing a complementary systems-level perspective exploring the potential roles of social enterprises in the eGovernment in the medium to long-term. Each of these intertwined strands of research are described further below.

To explore the role of social enterprises in eGovernment Services comparative case studies will be developed. These case studies will be interrogated by applying an established impact evaluation framework. A combination of methods will be used to undertake this investigation including existing knowledge and data based upon:

  • previous research
  • surveys
  • focus groups

Possible long-term pathways for the role of social enterprises in eGovernment services will also be developed. Seeking to address questions including:

  • to what extent, and how, can different actors influence pathways?
  • what might be the key technological, organisational and institutional changes involved in each pathway?

Interviews and focus groups with eGovernment practitioners (from across the public, private and third sector) will be employed as appropriate at each stage of the research.
